item.description:
This is a location that has a few interesting ponds and river areas that are perfect for recreational kayaks.

The pond portion has interssting big and little birds, the river porting is pretty interesting too...
A little bit of everything in a area that would be much larger elsewhere.

Ok i have a limited amount of kayaks..
some are already reserved..
but I have a OLD CANOE..its long and heavy..plastic type..
its been behind the garage for 15 or so years..looks water worthy..
I cant carry this monster...and it wont fit on the trailer very well...
Roof top..not on my car...it will go throug the moon roof LOL
SO....if you got some vehicle that can carry some 16 or 18 foot..canoe..then we can use it...
other wise it stays as a lawn ornament...


Getting there:
From Hartford: take I 84 east to exit 59 onto I 384 east.... When I 384 ends at rte 6 and 44..take the left split = rte 44 east.... for 7.8 miles and turn right onto rte 32 (Stafford Rd) go apx 1.8 miles then take a right on to rte 275 (South Eagleville Road) at the boat launch sign...
The access is on the right in apx .3 miles just after the dam/bridge on the right at the beginning of Pine Lake Drive...

For Mapquest, GPS, or others..use 38 Pine Lake Drive, Coventry, CT to get you close enough.

It only takes a few hours to see a lot here...we will think of something for food..thats a discussion for there on the water...

OR we cook it up right there..and make a good time of the day...

group.name: Connecticut Theatre Group Arts-Theater Events Group Discount

item.name: Recreational/Social Paddling and Pot luck meal at Eagleve dam in Coventry CT
